flawed_nl_solution:
Tony and Dean together read 23 + 12 = <<23+12=53>>53 books
3 of these books were duplicates so Tony and Dean together read 53 - 3 = <<53-3=50>>50 unique books
All three read 50 + 17 = <<50+17=67>>67 books
Because the books are being counted three times, the book is counted 3 - 1 = <<3-1=2>>2 extra times.
All together they have read 67 - 2 = <<67-2=65>>65 different books
#### 65

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 35, not 53. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
